Position Summary...
Join the Walmart US (WMUS) Total Rewards team to be a key partner to our Total Rewards Consultants at the world’s largest retailer. The Senior Manager, People Data Analytics works as part of a team to enable market attractive rewards for our associates by providing critical market analytics, tools, and insights to guide compensation strategy.

This is a high-impact and high-visibility role within the organization with expectations to deliver immediate results. The ideal candidate has a demonstrated passion for working with data to illuminate complex problems in the People domain. Your ultimate goal is to use data to derive insights that help to guide business outcomes and build strong relationships with the teams you partner with.

About Team:
The Walmart US Total Rewards team partners with the business to drive compensation initiatives for the 1.5 million associates across our field facilities (stores, supply chain, health & wellness) and the home office. We strive to ensure that our associates’ rewards are market attractive and aligned with our Total Rewards guiding principles.
What you'll do...
Own significant portion of a portfolio of reports & dashboards used daily by associates across Walmart business.
Shape proactive decision making by providing insights into economic, labor and wage market trends.
Help shape a data-driven culture by highlighting emerging trends and demonstrating how data connects to the business partner’s context and objectives.
Ensure data visualizations focus the attention of business leaders on key issues and ultimately enable better and faster decision making.
Think beyond the immediate question by creating reusable data frameworks that can address multiple needs and accelerate progress.
Define modeling methods that combine data from a variety of sources into robust data models that can be mined for insights using human and machine techniques.
Collaborates directly with senior leaders across People Analytics and partner organizations to define the appropriate approach to analytics for each domain.
Presents insights and recommendations to senior audiences; has the ability to influence decisions impacting tens of thousands of associates and hundreds of millions of dollars.
Works within the team to build relevant skills and in the broader analytics community at Walmart, Inc to continually improve all aspects of our analytics & insights capability.

What you'll bring...
This individual is expected to possess a solid technical foundation while demonstrating the ability to embed methods and practices across a team level to help everyone deliver maximum value. Ideal candidate would:
Have experience designing, building and maintaining highly usable and insightful reports & dashboards in a leading visualization suite (Tableau, Power BI, Looker etc)
Have experience working with large datasets, finding insights, and telling stories using data.
Have some experience programming in Python, Google Big Query, and SQL.
Know how to contribute in a Scrum environment managed in Jira, Azure DevOps or other product management platform.
Be able to effectively communicate through data using clear and concise summaries.
Knowledge of People/HR domain is a plus.
Proficiency in AI tools and creating intelligent agents is a plus.
Positive can-do attitude and curiosity to learn.

Position Summary and what you'll do in this role:
 he Walmart US eCommerce Marketplace team empowers sellers worldwide to reach millions of buyers. We're building innovative products and marketing strategies to enhance the shopping experience and drive growth. As a Senior Manager of Product & Marketing Analytics, you'll be the data-driven engine behind our product and marketing initiatives. You'll translate complex data into actionable insights, shaping product roadmaps, optimizing marketing campaigns, and ultimately, driving customer acquisition and engagement. This role sits at the intersection of Product, Marketing, Technology, and User Experience, offering high visibility and the opportunity to directly impact Walmart's eCommerce success. You'll build and scale analytics frameworks, fostering a data-informed culture and influencing strategic decisions at all levels. 
 You’ll make an impact by: 
 Driving Product Strategy: Partner with product managers to define key performance indicators (KPIs), analyze user behavior, and identify opportunities for product optimization and innovation. Develop data-driven roadmaps to improve product adoption and enhance the customer experience.  
Optimizing Marketing Performance: Analyze marketing campaign performance across various channels (e.g., paid search, social media, email) to identify trends, measure ROI, and optimize spend. Develop and implement A/B testing strategies to improve conversion rates and customer acquisition costs.  
Building Comprehensive Analytics Frameworks: Develop and maintain robust analytics dashboards and reports to track key product and marketing metrics. Utilize data visualization tools to communicate insights effectively to stakeholders.  
Conducting Deep-Dive Analyses: Proactively analyze customer and seller data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth. Conduct market research and competitive analysis to inform product and marketing strategies.  
Designing and Implementing Experiments: Develop and execute A/B tests and other experiments to measure the impact of product and marketing initiatives. Utilize statistical techniques to analyze results and draw meaningful conclusions.  
Collaborating with Cross-Functional Teams: Partner with product managers, marketing teams, engineers, and UX designers to ensure data-driven decision-making across the organization.  
Translating Data into Actionable Insights: Communicate complex data insights in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders at all levels, including senior leadership.  
Developing Predictive Models: Utilize machine learning and statistical modeling techniques to forecast trends, predict customer behavior, and identify potential risks and opportunities.  
Ensuring Data Integrity and Governance: Maintain data quality and consistency by adhering to data governance standards and best practices. Design data models and build pipelines/structure which follow data governance standards and facilitate seamless, timely and fast reporting reducing time to insights.  
Instrument data elements within Product Analytics Platforms (MixPanel, Google Analytics, Amplitude, etc.) and empower stakeholders by creating insightful dashboards and reports. 
Support Weekly, Monthly and Quarterly Business review with a focus on actionable insights that influence short, mid-term and long-term strategy. 
 
 You’ll sweep us off our feet if:  
 You have a proven track record of driving product and marketing success through data analysis.  
You possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.  
You have experience with marketing attribution, customer segmentation, and lifetime value analysis.  
You are proficient in SQL, Python, R, or other data analysis tools.  
You have experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.  
You are a self-starter with a strong sense of ownership and a passion for data-driven decision-making.  
You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and are comfortable with ambiguity.  
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.  
You have a startup mentality: scrappy, creative, drive, and passion to be best-in-class  
You move fast, with a builder mindset, learning and iterating.  
You are stimulated by challenges and are ready to engage at Fortune 1 scale.  
You are skilled at engaging and communicating with senior leaders both internal and external.

  Bachelor’s degree in Business, Analytics, Statistics, or related field and 4 years’ experience in data analytics, project management, business, or related in an eCommerce, Marketplace or Supply Chain environment.  
Strong SQL (writing complex queries), Product Analytics Tools (MixPanel, Google Analytics, Amplitude etc.) Microsoft Excel, Tableau, Looker or other data analytics and visualization tools
